    Hi! I am Mohammad, a PhD student in Information Security under the supervision of Andrei Sabelfeld and Daniel Hedin at Chalmers in Sweden, started in September 2019. Prior to that, I lived at Tehran Polytechnic (AUT) for 8 years (BSc in Software Engineering, MSc in Information Security, and PhD candidate in Software Engineering), where I found and began pursuing my passion for Language-Based Security, Information-Flow Security, and Formal Methods for Information Security, supervised by Mehran S. Fallah.

    Publications

    1. Securing Node-RED Applications, under review [pdf]
      Mohammad M. Ahmadpanah, Musard Balliu, Daniel Hedin, Lars Eric Olsson, and Andrei Sabelfeld
    2. SandTrap: Securing JavaScript-driven Trigger-Action Platforms, USENIX Security’21 [pdf]
      Mohammad M. Ahmadpanah, Daniel Hedin, Musard Balliu, Lars Eric Olsson, and Andrei Sabelfeld
    3. Nontransitive Policies Transpiled, EuroS&P’21 [pdf]
      Mohammad M. Ahmadpanah, Aslan Askarov, and Andrei Sabelfeld
    4. Improving Multi-Execution-based Mechanisms for Enforcing Information Flow Policies, Master’s thesis, 2017 [pdf]
      Supervisor: Mehran S. Fallah
    5. A Tool for Rewriting-Based Enforcement of Noninterference in While Programs, Bachelor’s thesis, 2015 [pdf]
      Supervisor: Mehran S. Fallah
